job_desc:
Project Overview
Within the project "Studying Autonomous Vehicles Policies with Urban Planning in Singapore", we aim to evaluate the feasibility of autonomous vehicle (AV) policies and investigate their land use and transport implications. The project focuses on the deployment of AVs in both greenfield and infill/brownfield areas in Singapore as well as the development of suitable urban design and AV operation schemes. Part of our research agenda involves the development of SimMobility, a microsimulation platform that integrates and links together various mobility-sensitive behavioral models with state-of-the-art simulators to predict impacts of mobility demands, infrastructure changes, and evolving transportation options on the deployment and delivery of people, firms, services and freight.
Responsibilities
